Power_Plant.__plant_base_load_comment__: electrial power required to run generic plant systems
Power_Plant.__tritium_plant_load_comment__: electrial power required to run the tritium processing plant
Power_Plant.__ecrh_power_efficiency_comment__: wall-plug to plasma efficiency for Electron Cyclotron Resonance (ECR) heating

Blanket.__breeder_coolant_comment__: details of the fluid used to extract heat; temperature in Celcius and pressure in bar
Blanket.__armour_thickness_comment__: thickness of the armour on the plasma-facing wall
Blanket.__shield_thickness_comment__: thickness of the shield on the rear of the blanket
Blanket.__wall_coolant_comment__: details of the fluid used to extract heat; temperature in Celcius and pressure in bar
Blanket.__wall_thickness_comment__: thickness of the vessel containing the breeder
Blanket.__wall_power_factor_comment__: ratio of thermal power deposited in blanket to neutron power emitted by plasma
Blanket.__breeder_power_factor_comment__: ratio of thermal power deposited in blanket to neutron power emitted by plasma

Divertor.__coolant_comment__: details of the fluid used to extract heat; temperature in Celcius and pressure in bar
Divertor.__armour_thickness_comment__: thickness of the armour on the plasma-facing surface
Divertor.__number_of_xpoints_comment__: defines single (1) or double (2) null divertor configuration
Divertor.__shield_thickness_comment__: thickness of the shield between the divertor and TF
Divertor.__shield_material_comment__: material composition of the shield, must match an entry in the Materials inputs
Divertor.__configuration_comment__: short leg; medium leg; long leg

Plasma.__scrape_off_layer_radiated_power_fracti: fraction of power conducted to the scrape-off layer that is radiated by pedestal impurity seeding
Plasma.__central_electron_temperature_comment__: central electron temperature (also know a Te0)
Plasma.__confinement_enhancement_factor_comment: factor to apply to ITER energy confinement scaling, also known as H-factor
Plasma.__bootstrap_model_comment__: 1 = Andrade equation 18; 2 = Andrade simple; 3 = simple model with user-defined constant; 4 = user defined constant
Plasma.__elongation_stability_factor_comment__: fraction of the maximum elongation that is allowed; value of 1.0 means elongation at the limit of stability
Plasma.__aspect_ratio_comment__: ratio between major and minor radius, A=R0/a
Plasma.__main_impurity_charge_comment__: average charge of plasma impurities (also known as Zimp)
Plasma.__elongation_comment__: ratio of plasma axial length and minor radius, kappa=a/ell
Plasma.__main_ion_tritium_fraction_comment__: fraction of main ions that are tritium (also known as fTritium) =nT0/nD0
Plasma.__triangularity_comment__: relative position of the apex, where 0=R0 and 1=R0-a. Also known as delta
Plasma.__temperature_profile_exponent_comment__: Temperature profile exponent, ST, such that T(r) = (1-r^2)^ST
Plasma.__plasma_wall_gap_comment__: gap between the plasma and the first wall
Plasma.__density_profile_exponent_comment__: Density profile exponent, Sn, such that n(r) = (1-r^2)^Sn
Plasma.__effective_ion_charge_comment__: effective charge of plasma ion species (also known as Zeff)
Plasma.__energy_confinement_time_scaling_law_co: Scaling law to use in energy-confinement time calculation. Options are ITER98; Petty; NSTX; MAST; NSTX-PB; GLOBUS.
Plasma.__normalised_current_drive_efficiency_co: Normalised current drive efficiency, CD_eff_norm, such that A/W = (0.031*CD_eff_norm*T0)/(R0*ne0)
Plasma.__central_electron_density_comment__: central electron density (also know a ne0)
Plasma.__toroidal_field_on_plasma_comment__: toroidal magnetic field at the plasma major radius

Commands.__sankey_comment__: flag to trigger an interactive Sankey diagram using Plotly
Commands.__cost_comment__: flag to trigger an assessment of LCOE using the Atkins cost model
Commands.__cad_comment__: flags (0 or 1) to use the FreeCAD API to generate a 3D model of a reactor sector and export the full 360 model as STL files
Commands.__mcnp_comment__: flag (0 or 1) to produce an MCNP input deck for the central column, which can be used to calculate heat and particle fluxes
Commands.__freegs_comment__: flag to call FreeGS to calculate the plasma equilibrium
Commands.__execution_mode_comment__: 1 = radial build based on TF parameters (variable shield thickness); 2 = fixed shield thickness (find maximum Bt); 3 = plasma temperature-density plot for identifying stable operating points
Commands.__geant4_comment__: flag (0 or 1) to produce geant4 inputs

TF.__critical_current_density_in_tape_comme: engineering critical current density across a tape; also known as J_eng
TF.__gamma_end_of_life_comment__: ratio of current density to the critical current density at the end of life
TF.__apex_offset_comment__: offset in the inboard direction for the apex of the coil, also known as cTF
TF.__critical_current_recovery_comment__: fraction of critical current recovered during annealling cycle
TF.__field_ripple_comment__: maximum ripple fraction in the field at the maximum radius of the plasma
TF.__gamma_comment__: ratio of current density to the critical current density for fresh tape
TF.__pancake_spacing_comment__: spacing reserved for insulation between two pancakes
TF.__vacuum_gap_comment__: gap between the core and the vacuum chamber (or other structure) required for thermal insulation

Central_Solenoid.__axial_spacing_comment__: spacing between the turns axially this will become part of the former
Central_Solenoid.__tf_gap_comment__: spacing between the rod radius and the solenoid
Central_Solenoid.__flux_swing_comment__: required flux swing at plasma major radius
Central_Solenoid.__former_thickness_comment__: thickness of the former onto which the solenoid is wound
Central_Solenoid.__turn_spacing_comment__: spacing between the turns i.e. the layers, this is filled with insulation

COMMENTS: ARIES cost model is for a 10th of a kind fusion power plant, with implicit learning rates applied
Doubling factor for N=10 is 3.3 therefore the following learning factors are estimated for different cost types:
Learning factor for Field Indirect Costs = 0.90

Inner_Vacuum_Chamber.__layers_comment__: data for each layer of the inner vacuum chamber starting with the plasma-facing side. Data is used to estimate the attenuation factor in addition to the centre column shield

Description: Estimate of STEP design point to see if valid with TE engineering assumptions

Cost_Model.__outage_duration_comment__: time taken to perform regular maintenance
Cost_Model.__dwell_fraction_comment__: average time between pulses, expressed as fraction of pulse length
Cost_Model.__capacity_factor_comment__: ratio of actual electrical energy output over a given period of time to the theoretical maximum electrical energy output over that period
Cost_Model.__cost_of_capital_comment__: return on capital expected from investment

Radiation_Shield.__coolant_comment__: details of the fluid used to extract heat; temperature in Celcius and pressure in bar
Radiation_Shield.__shield_power_factor_comment__: thermal power deposited in the bulk shield from neutrons, expressed as fraction of neutron power produced by plasma
Radiation_Shield.__wall_power_factor_comment__: thermal power deposited in the wall/armour from neutrons, expressed as fraction of neutron power produced by plasma
Radiation_Shield.__layers_comment__: data for each layer of the centre column shielding starting with the plasma-facing side. Data is used by the 3D model builder and thicknesses should be adjusted based on shield thickness from radial build
